title: OK! Serious Akali thread, what is wrong, what is right, what is meh.   Contributions encouraged.
body:
Hi I've mained Akali since season 1 under various other names. I have been seeing talk of Akali needing a rework and frankly that terrifies me when i look at reworks like kassadin. I think it's time we sat down and really talked about this.
@Meddler @BaconHawk @Riot @Reworkteams

Rules.) Don't flame the thread. That's it

Positive points (Imo)
1.) You can solo an entire team if you are fed and in a good position
2.) The enemy cannot hit you directly without pinks
3.) Can snowball amazingly well
4.) Large damage output on demand
5.) Requires going in to do damage
6.) Spell vamp fo' days
Bad points (Imo) 
1.) Feed or famine Akali either is fed as hell or irrelevant  
2.) little counter play in lane (and out to lesser extent)
3.) Little skill required (easy to snowball, much like kat) 
4.) Hard to catch if you to gank her
5.) Near impossible to get away from if she's on you
6.) Spell vamp fo' days

Meh points (Imo)
1.) Her E is really the only thing that I feel is meh as is in her kit. It serves little other purpose thank farming in the late game and just being a random extra damage spell that has no cohesion after the q proc part of it was removed.

Thoughts? Contributions encouraged.

replies.body:
Reworking a champion is **not **about making a strong champ weak or vice versa. It's about establishing playpatterns, counterplay, strengths, weaknesses, etc. I think Akali could use a touch-up on those. It should be clear what you're supposed to do when playing against Akali, and that shouldn't be "stay far far away from her". 

Imho, remembering to buy a pink ward isn't a very interesting counter to her W.

Spellvamp can be fine, but I've always felt it's problematic on her; it makes her very stat-check-y. It'd be more interesting to focus on her W as her tool for escapes if she's in too deep. 

**For example: **Remove Spellvamp. Make W smaller and give it two charges. Make her smokescreen targetable by R. Enemies entering the smoke have lower vision range but Akali is de-stealthed. 

That would gives her W a built-in reveal-mechanic; a tactical one rather than a strategic hard-counter one. Engaging enemies have to following her into her smoke to commit for a kill. It also gives Akali the option to escape if she saves one R-dash. Energy-management would be more important. On the other hand, when she engages she is a bit more vulnerable. That forces her to pick her engagements more carefully.

Dis I like.
Her passive is the most problematic part about her. You either have enough burst/tankiness to kill/survive her or you die. There is nothing to it.
I also think her passive is the most problematic. It creates her problems being a stat-check and makes her binary. It's not only a stat-multiplier, but an offense-to-defense one at that.

In other words, more or less turn her W into on-demand brush she can put out, with Graves W built into it against enemies?

I do think that sounds like a great idea how to improve her W.

Question about interaction with it. If you place a ward inside of it, will you see Akali?

I didn't realize it would work almost exactly like brush and Graves' Smokescreen, haha. 
Gut reaction on using wards in it is I'd feel the way I do about ward-hopping, which is not great. If it's designed to encourage a specific behavior allowing wards feels kind of cheaty. 
Others might see it otherwise, as with ward-hopping. Playtesting could show allowing wards as a counter actually is a good idea.

What would happen if a teammate is inside the shroud, would whole team see her or not?

It being like a brush is not a bad idea at all, and the overall idea behind shroud working something like that, is much better.

Personally I feel neither ward OR teammates should reveal her, because it's part of her assassination to go in on a single target, and if she uses her shroud then, she would be revealed to whole team. Her W would be useless in teamfight then. If only person inside veil could see her it would be her way of forcing a 1v1 in a teamfight more or less, until teammates can get close.

No idea if it's fun or not, it would need testing.

Akali being invisible to everyone but one person might be too confusing; all other vision in the game is shared except to targets affected by Graves' W and Noc's R. This would be the reverse to those though. It would be pretty weird seeing your ally fight an invisible enemy. 

Or would your ally disappear into the smoke as well? That _could_ be an interesting mechanic, but it might not be a good fit for Akali.
Even without the expanded vision-denial she could drop a cloud at the edge of the fight to R and escape through it in a pinch. With two clouds she could juke between them as well.

Hmm, the ALLY disappearing as well would be pretty cool. You do bring up a legit point though, it does break the current expectations of team-vision.

The issue is that in a teamfight Akali will pretty much always be seen and her W not very useful then, unless she purely uses it for escapes and for something to jump on.

Also I do think it should be a smokebomb or similar she throws, giving it more range, to allow her something to jump to, or to create sneaky plays.

I mean there is lots of ideas, but they would need to be tested out, there is too many what ifs... worst part being a forum-goer instead of a designer =/

Something similar could have been tested already, for all we know! Who knows.

Either way, some extra notes: 

I think, between the two, an invisible ally would be less confusing than an ally fighting an invisible enemy.

In teamfights W would still create crucial moments of respite for Akali; it could be used to stealth from or momentarily nullify ADC's, as an escape route, to blind an enemy trying to engage or be used on an enemy that jumped you to disorient him while you run or R out. 

An enemy wouldn't want to be in the cloud if he could avoid it, as it'd make him blind and somewhat impotent to what's going on outside; no-one would be able to fight well while standing in it. For example, you could bait a Tank into the pool and then jump their ADC while the Tank is disoriented.

If your enemy risk dying to Akali he wouldn't want to enter at all, even if Akalis health was low. Just like on live.

Two pools would give you insane juking tools. In and out one pool, R'ing between two pools, running back and forth between two adjacent pools or bush, etc.

Also, If you were sitting in the pool you'd be able to see if anyone was on their way to enter, at which point you can run out the other way. The vision loss would give you an extra moment to run while they are in the cloud (which could still have the current slowing component).

At a second glance, the main problem might be it's way too OP. It'd have to be pretty small and have a short duration, probably.

Yea it might be quite strong, but that means power could be shaved off from elsewhere. It would become her identity, and it probably means much of her burst would be moved, and instead she would turn into a hard to catch assassin.

It would give her proper fall-back patterns and overall make her less one dimensional, it would give her some utility.

Biggest issue with current Akali is that she almost completely lack utility, which is the main fall-back pattern for any champ. Once they do not have enough power they can still do SOMETHING through their utility abilities.

Zed have his strong escapes, that allows him to splitpush, and he have slows to do something, and easier get out.

LeBlanc have her roots to do something even as she falls behind, even if it's not as much, she can also play around her mobility as well.

Akali she have her current cloud, which offers a weak slow, and that's it. She is not a very good splitpusher, as she lack escapes and doesn't take towers overly easy, and near turrets she lose to many champs, without her cloud she is not a very good duelist, and many bruisers beat her up.

For her to be a healthy champ she need something she is strong at, something unique she brings to the table, except just deleting people. I believe a different working smoke bomb could be that thing.

Another possibility would be to change her E into some sort of CC ability. It's currently borderline useless. If she lost her current passive, got a stronger more versatile W, was given more counterplay on her Q, and overall had much less burst, her current R wouldn't be horrible.

The issue with her current R is how extremely bursty she is, and how little space opponent have for counterplay. If she instead of being instant-delete assassin instead had to play around utilizing her smokes, and overall had a longer assassination window, and needed to do more than just stick to people till they died, I do believe she could be more interesting to play against.
Reducing or just removing her R's damage is something I've also thought about before.

Yea her QR+AA burst is the issue, in combination of how reliable it is. Only problem is... she have nothing else.

It wouldn't change a thing if you moved some of her power to her E, and it doesn't change anything if you move her Q damage from pop, to hit.

IF her damage got nerfed, she would be pretty much useless, as she have nothing else. If she got a bruiser/tank pattern, as long as she deals decently high damage, it would be even worse (Warmog Akali being one of the most abuse Akali phases), as she then can't be focused down or dealt with, with a team before she kills the squishy, and would take much more resources to deal with.

She needs something new, she need changes, until then she just wont work out.

I don't have much to add at the moment, going to follow this thread with interest though. Akali's a champ we've had trouble balancing over the years, so while we don't currently have a rework for her underway, one's certainly not out of the question at some point. Pretty interested in hearing people's thoughts on her as a result.

She needs a rework.. The fact that every time you buff her, she becomes insanely overwhelming, or when you nerf her, she becomes trash tier, is an indication she is not well designed. 

There's also really no reason to pick her over Diana anymore after all her nerfs.

This is the problem with Riot trying to only nerf weaknesses and buff strengths - when the strength of the champion is what makes it unfun to play against (or hard to balance), no amount of nerfs to weaknesses will fix it.
OR they just aren't hitting the right marks. Q Pun not intended.

Idk, there are many Akali mains that like her simplistic kit. It's definitely a different case than Urgot, and other planned reworks that we know about. Maybe a rework is needed but I feel like community should always come first. I mean in terms of balance I would understand shifts such as Karma to being into a more supportive role than what she used to be. But changing Akali's style or how she feels/plays as a whole   would turn off her appeal. Although, making her more ninjustu rather than dash and assasinate does sound intriguing, it doesn't solve how the fan base feels about that play style. I'm not sure what you could do to her kit with out making her laning phase worse or some other aspect really difficult to learn her again.

However, you could always do little things before you do finally reach a resolution. You could try a creative mechanic like allowing her to E mid R to give her that Yasuo E-Q effect (without the knock up bonus effect ofcourse) and allow it to decrease something in cooldown or reward her in energy for the amount of champs hit?.
It doesn't have to be a large one. Ashe's rework is popular. I think they should only change the passive and e. Tweak the other spells.

You are right, it doesn't have to be a large one. Which is quite problematic because there isn't a direct clarification on the amount of work that would go into a rework unless you specify the kit changes. Hearing your main and words rework  together certainly does sound frightening tbh. There are many levels of rework; Xerath, Nidalee, Heimerdinger, Karma, Trundle, etc. Good thing the topic is up for discussion before Riot does anything because change could be good in hindsight but at the same time it could definitely be looked down upon. It's all up in thin air at this point because if the answer is yes she does need a rework, the bigger question would be how. As a player and not a designer we don't have much power when it comes to reworks. Riot definitely has more resources for in-depth analysis on what makes or breaks a champ as time goes on. I'm sure there are a few unhealthy champs they want to work on but don't know how to go about it because of the amount of time and resources needed to make the change without tampering the champs identity or play style.

Sidenote: To clarify I don't main Akali, I'm only speaking out my opinion on the situation. I would never speak out on the fan-base's behalf because I have no right to, but I have definitely seen many  people pissed off at some reworks. Normally people just shrug it off and deal with the change or move on to another champion. Usually overtime people will get over it, but I'm glad Meddler asks how we feel about it. Which is funny because we as a community hated the proposed Lee Sin changes but as time went on people actually want it to happen.

Well first you need to know what her identity is. What sets her apart from other champions? She's an assassin. What makes her different than Zed or Talon? She's an AP Assassin. What sets her apart from Diana (who needs a rework), LeBlanc, or Fizz?

What's fun to play as her? What's fun about playing against her?

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dQqZ5sw8,comment-id=00010002000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-19T13:01:05.742+0000)
>

> 
> What's fun to play as her? What's fun about playing against her?

I enjoy that her kit is not based around mechanics, but planning and tactics. LeBlanc and Fizz are all about those flashy plays for kills, and Akali thinks about what the steps of the battle are, with less reaction and more forethought.

Against her? Ummm...well...it feels good to kill her. Help me out here guys, I cna;t think of a whole lot at the moment.

That's...more or less the problem really. For a long time, Akali really wasn't fun to fight. She's in a bad state right now, but you have to admit her Q and R were kind of broken.


To the person fighting her, it doesn't FEEL like any planning or tactics were involved. At all. All you know is you just got popped for walking within a couple steps of her after gunblade, and now between her resets and that NOBODY ON YOUR TEAM IS BUYING PINKS, EVEN THO-

*Ahem*


Don't get me wrong, I know that she has counters, and really, she wasn't stupid OP to begin with. But she just...wasn't fun to lane against once she hits 6. 


There's a difference between a powerspike at 6/first item and what AKali had. I'd argue it was the biggest spike in the game.

I'm pretty sure this is why she has such a weak early laning phase. Even Post-6 it is weak if you play your lane properly.

You just have to zone her out; this is easily achieved using ANY champion with the exception of Katarina. It's more of a skill thing at that point. 

I've played games where I zoned the akali so hard that she only had 15-20 cs by level 6 with mine being several times higher than hers.

Yah, and I understand that. I can do it too pretty well (Admitedly difficult on some of the mids I play, but I can do it.)


However, with Akali, it doesn't feel like keeping an enemy down. It feels like I'm  simply prolonging my slowly shrinking lead. All it takes is a gank from the enemy jungler (Which would admittedly be my fault) Or her to pick up a few kills once a team fight starts.


It's just...after so many games of thinking Akali was down, only for her to finally scrape enough gold together for a gunblade and murder your support in a few team-fights to snowball into an unstoppable killing machine. That's just not fun.

I love taking her out of stealth, or pouncing on her when she's in it or when her shroud is down. I think her shroud is a big part of her identity, and while I don't play her, I think her kit could revolve more around it, like Zed and his shadows.

Fun about playing against Akali?  Nothing.  She's on a lot of players hate list for the following reasons:

**1)  Riot's old assassin design** - Basically an 'i win' ultimate justified by 'pre-6 weakness', when the latter is easily addressed by health potions.  Even if you can stay ahead of her in lane, all it takes is one roam and she's suddenly ahead of you.

**2)  Stealth** - No one likes playing against stealth.  Relying on itemization just to _fight_ Akali (you still might lose) blows.  It's even worse than QSS because at least that item counters the enemy's strength.  Getting vision of Akali does nothing to stop her damage.

**3)  Resets **- Just another way to punish players for their teammates not building defense or not leaving a fight when they get low.  This also leads into the next point:

**4)  She warps the game** - Very few champs (usually reset champs) warp the game as Akali does.  Where most league games are a 5v5, games with these champs in them become a 'focus X and pray we have enough resources left over to deal with their other threats'.  I'm not talking about any old squishies here, as the difference between getting a reset and not is larger than the difference between the ADC getting off an extra few autos and not.  


Noticeably absent on my list is her passive.  Yea, Riot should probably change it to be consistent with their move against free gold passives, but honestly it doesn't bother me.  You can nerf her passive all you want, the above points are still going to hold true.

She's on many players' hate lists because of the "Me" concept people seem to have in a "team" game. Oh she roamed and is therefore ahead of "me" now. OK so why is that the champion's fault again?

 Is it not logical that when someone gains a kill they get ahead?

 Is it not logical that if they obtained the kill it was a simple misplay on your teammates and possibly your part?

1) It is justifiable to have a powerful ultimate in exchange for a weak early game. Why? It's not hard to zone someone out. Most people tend to want to play safe EVEN THOUGH THEY KNOW THAT IN DOING SO, THEY WILL LOSE THE ADVANTAGE ONCE THEY HIT 6. Learn to zone out your opponent. Learn to apply lane pressure. Learn LANE MECHANICS.

2) I've never had to buy a pink against a stealth champion. Yea, they can stealth so what? I learned to work around it without having to buy a pink. Perhaps you and others should do some thinking too. It might help you learn how to work around it as well. It's called adaptation. Learn it. Use it. It was programmed as a survival tool in our brains for a reason people.

3) Another way to punish someone for not leaving a fight when they get low? What are you EVEN SAYING!?!? If someone dies to someone else because they were stupid enough to think they can win a fight while being low ALL THE WHILE KNOWING WHAT THAT OTHER CHAMPION IS CAPABLE OF then they deserved to die. How did you even come to the conclusion that this is a valid point?

4) How is it not logical to focus a champion who's role is to quickly kill off your carries? Who then should we focus? their bruisers? their tanks? both of whom are meant to absorb damage? Where is your logic coming from? I don't even...............

I assure you, if she roamed bottom and killed bottom, she's not just ahead of 'me', she's ahead of bottom and likely top too.  Of course it's logical that you get ahead when you get a kill - my point was that pre-6 weakness is being leaned on too much when alloting Akali's power budget (specifically the giant power spike she gets with ult).  

The rest of your post is thinly veiled chest thumping being used as a poor defense of Akali.  

The post I replied to asked why Akali's so unfun to play against and I answered.  The points I listed are more or less specific to Akali, as opposed to your post which is trying to ignore the things that make Akali more annoying to deal with than most.  

For example, you ask why players can't just focus the damage dealer.  Well, when that champion has stealth and resets, it's both harder to focus them and more punishing when you fail.

Those resets are precisely the reason that your teammates refusing to leave a fight when they are low is worth bringing up in Akali's case beyond just pointing out that those teammates made a mistake - because you get actively punished for it.  

Stupid teammates are also worth noting because even if you are a stealth-countering god who never needs pinks (*cough*bullshit*cough*), your teammates might not be, and that stealth is going to impact their play too.

I already explained my stance on her pre-6 weakness, but just to be clear, her kit has very little room for counterplay and because it also has great ease of target selection, it boils down to a gear check a lot of the time, which makes for very dull lanes.  Don't try to ignore the important parts of this point - she's not every assassin because not every assassin has point-and-click long-range gapclosing, so they can actually be outplayed.  She's not every champion with a good ultimate, as those ultimates can also be outplayed or actually have meaningful cooldowns.  She's not every champion with point-and-click abilities either, as a lot of these champs lack the burst that Akali gets.  It's the package deal that makes Akali so unfun to play against.

**I get that many people looking at Akali buffs may not be akali players and don't truly understand why she is so underwhelming but Why do I feel like no other akali mains even see this issue no one but me sees that her combo does not function correctly

giving her buffs that don't fix the issue is meaningless,Q is so clunky and unreliable in her combo 

The travel time just kills her you Q ult then wait stand there till it hits...alternatively you can wait till after you ult to Q but that gives them enough time for them to leave AA range just destroying your combo making you use another R to close distance slowing your burst to a crawl getting her CCed or killed late game

Its already hard enough getting an AA in as its just naturally a slow animation for a burst champion but god damn now you have work around a clunky main source of damage of damage that's it just plain frustrating to play her and that's why i dropped her, not because shes weak but she just not working right 

Before her e would offset this by giving her range to proc the Q but since it was nerfed it made it clear how bad the Q spell works

_**ONLY BUFF AKALI NEEDS IS DOUBLE THE MISSILE SPEED ON Q**_
Legit point!

R puts her too far behind the target. Literally if they walk toward you as you R, when you try to Auto and proc MotA, half of the time they're already out of range so either increase Akali's AA range slightly or fix R.

EDIT: And it's not an issue on my end. Game is running at a constant 200+ FPS and <50 ms ping.

If a rework were to occur, i think the following needs to be addressed:

> 1. The Gunblade Uber Synergy has to be removed (passive rework). I hate being forced to build it on her as not doing so is gimping yourself. Less options means boring, though the oomph of a powerspike is always appreciated in terms of feels. A gameplay passive would be recommended, something that allows her to spell weave, give her decision points for trades, chases and teamfights within her rotations. 
> 
> 2. She needs a combo. While E proccing Q was a bad thing, it made her more interesting to play because it gave her inter-spell interaction. Gave her options along the lines of Yasuo Q-E combo. The problem with the E proc is that it was almost always the better option. I'd like to see an interaction return, but with more depth than a proc.
> 
> 3. Her E is simply bland. I know it's difficult to come up with something different as I've brainstormed on a few options within a set of requirements, but this is truly the greatest point of improvement that Akali can have. Resources are best put here. 

Her Q and R used to be broken, but with all the changes to them, they now have better risk/reward distributions and R even has counterplay now. No changes needed here. Similar with W, though the low level MS increase in W really needs to be higher.

Credibility: Akali enthusiast since season 1

Everyone has that one super item though that they cannot afford to omit from their build.

But Akali's synergy with gunblade is even better than a Zed with BotRK or a Fizz with Lich Bane. So I understand the frustration, and she is one of around 2 champs that use it in their main build (Ekko might but we will see when he comes out).

I feel the biggest issue with Akali is that there is too little things she can do, and even less opponent can do. Playing against Akali, means you either need a team to help kill her, you need to stay far away from her, or you win the stat-check battle against her.

Fighting Akali is closer to a stat-check than anything else, and she have several things that makes her very uninteresting to fight against.

A. She gains lifesteal/spellvamp. This means when she is attacking a squishy she becomes deceptively tanky, and you need to massively outdamage her, and tanks can't kill her, as they rely on wittling opponent down, and she just heals off of them.

B. She turns invisible in her cloud, and it is quite binary in a fight. If you have sweeper or pink ward, the skill become borderline useless to Akali and she turns much much more vulnerable as she relies on waiting for cooldowns a bit. On the other hand if there is no way to see her, she becomes extremely hard to deal with. It's a very binary interaction.

C. More or less a team is required to fight her, but if there is a team around, she struggles big time unless extremely fed. When enemy have exhaust, shields, CC, see-invis, she can't do much about it. She have no fall-back pattern. In case there is not a team, she just kills the target, without much of any interaction, unless she is too weak to do that, then she just fails and can't do much.

D. Limited moments of weakness. Her Q have so short cooldown, it's pretty much always up. Her R being down is just temporary, and with all the stacks she can have it's very hard to play around it, and it's easy for Akali to conserve her stacks until a fight. Ahri have the working version of Akalis ultimate, with clear moments of weakness, and forcing usage of Ahri's ultimate is a big thing. With Akali, forcing usage of one stack is not a big deal, and making her use all her stacks is extremely hard.

E. Low interaction with her. Akali have her main damage tools being her Q and R, both are point and click targeting. If you are within range, you will be hit, and with 3 stacks of her R, you can't escape her, doesn't matter if you have dashs and flash, there is no getting away, as she match your movement with her dashs. Only way to get away is to get under a tower, and win the fight there, or have her give up. There is extremely limited amount of outplay possible against her.

What Akali needs is some combos, more tools, utility and weaknesses. She need to be able to fail, or succeed at a tactical level, and less amount of her power in simple point and clicks. I don't think she can be fixed without a rework, of at least Veigar/Zilean size. Shifting power back and fourth doesn't solve her issues.

There's plenty of counterplay for her. Even champions with NO mobility have a way to win an engage. It's really not that hard. People just need to actually THINK critically about what they need to do and IMPROVE their play. Yes point and click is frustrating but it's not impossible to win against otherwise Annie/Katarina would be invincible in mid lane.

Honestly, the biggest problem I've always had with Akali, is her insane amount of sustain. When she's strong, she's overwealming, when she's weak, she's situational at best.

With her nerfs to her ult range, and that E doesn't proc Q bonus damage, she's in a decent spot, but because of her innate massive sustain, she's frustrating to play against when she gets ahead, and once she get's ahead, there's not really much you can do about it.

The things that NEED to stay for Akali to be reworked, are her W and her ult. Those two things are super super Iconic to Akali. Her Q is honestly just there to gate her damage and control her gameplay. Her E is just an energy sink and a way to farm late game.

Akali is the first Champion I bought, and my main up until her recent nerfs (after which I still love her, but have been focusing on improving my top lane play so haven't gotten used to it yet). I feel she's actually in a pretty nice place right now. I enjoy her mechanics, as they go beyond what everyone seems to think about. Sure she's very binary, with few combos and a stat matchup, but the true skill in playing Akali comes in picking your fights, using limited tools to escape rough situations with a bit of luck and positioning, and planning your fights.

----------
Good points for Akali:
----------

Analysis is critical, as you have to decide who to jump on, where you plan to escape, how will you do it, and then evolve that plan as the fight rapidly progresses. I give that the fight itself is very simple, but her planning is more complex than most.

In the new tank meta, a stat-check isn't so bad. It forces Akali to play as an assassin. She shouldn't be trying to take on tanks, she should be on the prowl for squishies. It help to clearly define her role.

She might not have a lot of counterplay, but she's not Zed. You can't just escape from a sticky situation, your actions have consequences. Also, CC her, she's dead.

I find her spell-vamp positive, as it allows her to attack the bursty people that should be her targets in the first place.
-----------
Bad points for Akali:
-----------

As mentioned above, she has problems with feed-or-famine and binary fights.

Recent changes to her E have made it incoherent with the rest of her kit. That needs to be changed. maybe give it a long cooldown, a high energy cost, and a vortex effect, drawing enemies in to further prevent escape.

Very little counterplay. If you're a squishy champ, you die. If not, you live.

On the negative side of spell-vamp, tanks have a harder time against her, but they usually can just build MR and do fine long enough to fall back to tower or get help.

----------------
I realize that I mentioned some points in both categories, but I'm giving the upsides and downsides to those points.
----------------

In summary, Akali has problems, but they feed into her strengths and identity. Her E needs work, but otherwise she's pretty solid. I for one would be sorely disappointed if she were reworked.

I don't main her but I think she is at a good point. The fact that she MUST auto in order to trigger her Q now is a good thing. Before when I used to play akali pre-rework, it was easy for me to win ANY lane match up simply from making plays. I could win against kat, LB, and virtually any other laner aside from Fizz whom I didn't have a chance to face. I haven't really played her enough post-re work so it is hard to say how she is now, but as a well seasoned plat 5 mid main, I can say from general experience and theory crafting that she is in a decent place.

Sure she does high damage still but she is an assassin. This is what she is meant to be doing. That's not the issue. The issue was the counter play and it is definitely more there now than it was before. The need to auto to trigger her Q gives more time for reacting to her. Proper judgment will determine whether you can counteract an engage from her or not. That is, if you're a squishy champion like adc, you really shouldn't be engaging her 1v1 or even 2v1 unless one of you has cc.

To me, she's just like some of the other typical assassins {{champion:55}} {{champion:91}} . They have weak early game but scale well into late game if they are left unchecked. Assassins should scale well into late game, especially with the current meta being a tank meta. Other assassins should follow this example in my opinion; like {{champion:7}} {{champion:238}}, both of whom are well capable of becoming lane dominant after level 2. Of course this could also be said of {{champion:55}} , but she requires a bit more skill to be played as a lane dominating champion at level 2 or 3 (yes this is possible as I've done so on VERY many occasions).

I suppose if you really wanted to make a change on her, you could increase the delay in her ability to recast her ult to give players more breathing room. I mean with her E being at 1 second at max rank, I think it is justifiable to increase her ult delay slightly.

What's really annoying is that nobody really seems to understand her.  A lot of common arguments made towards Akali's balance are:
1) If she has the numbers she kills you.

That can really be said about any Assassin.  Leblanc a little fed?  You're dead.  Zed has an item or two?  You're dead.  Kat got Luden's with a slight lead?  You're dead.  Talon?  You're dead.  And so on and so forth.  That's how Assassins work.  If they have the numbers and enough items to do a good amount of damage and they miraculously get passed all of the peel the carries get then you should die.  That's just how it is with Assassins whether you like it or not

2) Never ending kill pressure.

The problem with this is that she has no kill pressure whatsoever until level 6.  She used to have some kill pressure against melees pre 6 but that ended when E Mota proc was removed.  The reality is, although she may have some kill pressure after her ult, other champions have much higher kill pressure throughout the whole game.  Leblanc has kill pressure starting from level 2 and on.  Kat and Zed can poke you down as they please until they are ready to go in.  Fizz has arguably the best level 1 out of all Assassins and once he hits 6 even without his ult up he can still kill you easily.  The point is, when compared to other Assassins, Akali's kill pressure is sub par at best.

3) Muh Spellvamp

All Assassins have some means of staying alive and since her shroud has been nerfed to hell and is hilariously unreliable she needs the spellvamp to help her not get destroyed in fights.

4) She can pentakill your whole team ezpz xd

No.  She really can't unless she completely outplays your whole team or you're just bad.  Her teamfight is sub par at best because of how unreliable her shroud is.  Another thing people don't understand is that once she's in, she's in.  Unless she can jump to a minion (highly unlikely) then she is not getting out.  Meanwhile, Leblanc can instantly port back after her job is done, Zed can blink back to his shadow out of a fight when he's done, you can't do jack shit to Kat when she's teleporting all over the place, Fizz has his trollpole, and even Talon has a somewhat reliable escape.  Akali doesn't.  

Don't forget that she is one of the few Assassins that cannot 100-0 her target unless incredibly fed.  She has always been an assassin that takes 2 spell rotations to kill her target meaning you have plenty of time to react in a teamfight.  Other Assassins like Zed, Leblanc, and Talon just dump their load on you instantly and you die with little to no time to react.  Akali takes much longer making her teamfight all that much weaker.

****

To be honest even when she's strong she is still one of the weakest Assassins at best.  All I really want are for the ult change to be completely reverted (no amount of tinkering with it will ever make it not terrible to play with) and her E to proc Mota again (prep for the downvotes).  I honestly don't even want E to proc Mota again just because it would be a buff.  I want it to proc it again so her E is actually useful and she doesn't feel clunky as fuck to play as.  I used to really love playing Akali but after all these changes she just feels really terrible and I play her less and less because of how clunky she is as well as how unfun she is to play as.  Just give her those two things and then you can go ahead and destroy her when you rework her a few seasons from now.
